thread.title: Cathedral HS Football Players Suspended Over Hazing
thread.title_full: Cathedral HS Football Players Suspended Over Hazing

author: GADI SCHWARTZ and JONATHAN LLOYD
title: Cathedral HS Football Players Suspended Over Hazing
text: Cathedral High School Football Players Suspended Due to Hazing The hazing, involving freshmen and upper classmen, occurred earlier this week at the all-boys Catholic school campus Cathedral High School Football Players... Link Close Embed this video <script type="text/javascript" charset="UTF-8" src="http://www.nbclosangeles.com/portableplayer/?cmsID=336376581&videoID=dXS1BvhdI8y_&origin=nbclosangeles.com&sec=news&subsec=sports&width=600&height=360"></script> More videos (1 of 9) « » At least eight Southern California high school football players were kicked off one of the region's top teams after reports of hazing. Ted Chen reports for the NBC4 News at Noon on Friday Oct. 23, 2015. (Published Friday, Oct. 23, 2015) At least eight Southern California high school football players were kicked off one of the region's top teams after reports of hazing. Cathedral High School's administration has opened an investigation into allegations of hazing earlier this week at the all-boys Catholic school. The hazing involved freshmen and upper classmen and occurred in and out of the team's locker room. Clarkson Hurt, Lakers Lose to Warriors Details regarding the hazing were not immediately available. Parents of players, who asked not to appear on camera, said the allegations involved players being forced into trash cans. Principal Brother John Montgomery said the school also notified the Los Angeles Police Department. No arrests were reported Friday morning. Football Players Suspended in Alleged Hazing Incident The LA Cathedral High School administration has launched an investigation into an alleged hazing incident. Gadi Schwartz reports for the NBC4 News at 11 p.m. on Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015. (Published Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015) "Administrators took the immediate action and met with the football team Wednesday after school and players were told about the suspensions and reiterated that hazing of any type or for any reason is not allowed at the all-boys private Catholic high school," said Principal Brother John Montgomery in a statement. Cathedral High School in Elysian Park is the No. 1 ranked team in the Southeast Division at 7-0. The team's next game is scheduled for 7 p.m. Friday at St. Francis in La Canada Flintridge. NBC4 also has emailed the school's athletic director for comment. Published at 5:54 AM PDT on Oct 23, 2015
